traceability.evidence: The implementation in src/fetch-version-times.js always invokes `npm view time --json` to retrieve publish dates for all versions, and src/build-rows.js blindly uses only the latest version’s timestamp rather than fetching or considering only versions newer than the current one. There is no logic filtering out versions older than the current version before fetching or processing, despite the acceptance criterion “Smart Fetching: Only fetch versions newer than current (optimization)”. No tests verify this optimization is in place.
traceability.notes: All other acceptance criteria—fetching version times, calculating age, and displaying ages—are covered by code and tests, but the optimization to limit fetching to newer versions is not implemented.
